Instruction: Heat the oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit (165 degrees Celsius).
Cream butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.

Mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl; set aside. Using an electric mixer, beat together the eggs, milk, and melted butter in a large bowl until smooth. Blend the flour mixture into the liquid ingredients until a smooth batter forms.
Form dough into small crescent shapes and place on ungreased baking sheets.
In the preheated oven, cook until bubbly and golden brown, approximately 1 hour.
Combine the cooled crescents with 1/2 cup of confectioners' sugar by rolling them until they are thoroughly coated.
Do not over-mix the cookie dough in this recipe for optimal results.
